Package main

Class Battle

java.lang.Object
main.Battle
public class Battle extends Object
A battle contains an inventory of enemy monsters that the player can fight. The player gains score and gold rewards if they win.
Author:
Farzad and Daniel

  • Constructor Details

    • Battle

      public Battle()
      Create a new Battle object. Set the value of game to the given GameEnvironment object. Randomize the enemy monsters inventory.

    • setup

      public void setup() throws NotFoundException
      Check that the player monster inventory contains at least one non fainted monster.
      Throws:
      NotFoundException - if the player has no non fainted monsters in their team

    • playerAttack

      public String playerAttack()
      choose a random player monster to attack a random enemy monster. Turn over to the enemy.
      Returns:
      result the commentary of the events that occurred during the attack

    • enemyAttack

      public String enemyAttack()
      choose a random enemy monster to attack a random player monster. Turn over to the player.
      Returns:
      result the commentary of the events that occurred during the attack

    • playTurn

      public String playTurn()
      Play the next turn in the battle.
      Returns:
      result the commentary of the events that happened during the turn

    • play

      public String play() throws NotFoundException
      Play the battle. Start with the player attacking and take turns alternating between enemy and player. Checks the player team before the game to make sure they have at least one non fainted monster. Checks the status of the battle after each turn. Stop when one team's monsters have all fainted.
      Returns:
      the commentary of the battle
      Throws:
      NotFoundException - if the player has no non fainted monsters in their team

    • checkStatus

      public String checkStatus()
      checks the status of the battle. If the player's monsters have all fainted, then the player loses. If the enemy's monsters have all fainted, then the player wins.
      Returns:
      the commentary of the battle's outcome

    • win

      public String win()
      Player wins the game. Add to the battles won. Add rewards to the player balance and score.
      Returns:
      result the commentary of the player winning the battle

    • lose

      public String lose()
      Player loses the game. Add to the battles lost.
      Returns:
      result the commentary of the player losing the battle

    • randomSize

      public int randomSize()
      get a random number between 1 and the maximum numbers of monsters that the player can have
      Returns:
      the inventory size

    • randomName

      public String randomName()
      get a random battle name from the given file
      Returns:
      the selected name

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      result the string representation of the battle object

    • view

      public String view()
      Returns:
      result the string representation of the battle object with by command line options
